website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you want a wooden mallet that is especially useful for woodworking tasks, though it's a bit pricey and won't work on all surfaces.
pros: This unique mallet is crafted in solid beechwood, which is ideal for projects that require a material that's more solid than rubber
Earns praise for its balanced performance
cons: There's a chance some rough areas on the mallet will need a bit of sanding upon arrival
Rarely, the head has been known to pop off with heavy striking on hard objects

website_summaries.verdict: A solid mallet that renders excellent control. If you're looking to upgrade from a rubber mallet, this is a fine choice.
pros: Solid hardwood construction and reasonable price considering the quality you get
cons: Occasional durability concerns about the product

customer_reviews.title: But as I've been getting into real fine furniture building
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using a rubber mallet or regular hammer with my chisels to do a variety of tasks. Yes, I know, real woodworkers are cringing. But as I've been getting into real fine furniture building, I decided on some better gear. The difference is huge. I'm not sure of the correct terms; whether it's vibration or feedback or whatever, but this thing just gives me much more control over what I'm doing. It's solid and feels great to use. Feels like I'm a proper gentleman woodworker now. (You know, without all the actual skills maybe. But still... I got a fancy mallet now so I'm 1/2 way there.)
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not ready to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The manufacture need to put a little more details on these descriptions. This is a mallet blank. All of the edges are sharp including the handle. If you purchased this mallet expect to spend an hour finishing it. It needs to be sanded and the sharp corners take it off. After that you'll have a wooden mallet that can be used safely and comfortably to tap your chisels.
customer_reviews.author: The Carolina Dude

customer_reviews.title: This is a great mallet for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mallet for the price. It is very hard and tough and has stood up to some serious work already. Nothing to complain about. To those who complain that it split striking a fore or other object, that is not the purpose of the tool. Its a joiners mallet, made for lighting striking a chisel or lightly hammering up tough joints together. When used as intended, I have no doubt it will last and last.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler MooreTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a hardwood mallet
customer_reviews.text: Don't worry about the other reviews. This is a solid hardwood mallet, that is great for woodworking. If you are into being a tinker or working wood you can make adjustments for your taste. I took the advice of soaking boiled linseed oil into it for the finish. Drilled a hole in the handle for a leather shoe lace hanger. Wished I found it sooner. Good weight for tapping wood chisels.
customer_reviews.author: Rexthedog

customer_reviews.title: Great for crushing ice.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with a lewis bag (heavy cotton bag used to hold ice cubes that you crush for cocktails). It's large and mallety and does exactly what its supposed to do. Quality seems decent but then again i'm a drinker not a craftsman.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been on a search for quite some time now for the perfect wood mallet. I have finally found it. This mallet is so well balanced and comfortable in your hand. Straight out of the box it feels like it has been worn in for years in your own hand. I can't imagine needing another mallet other than this, but if I do ever need to replace it I will be hard pressed trying to find something better than this. This mallet seems like one of those, "too good to be true moments", but it's not at all. BUY THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great for crushing ice!!
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this mallet to crush ice with ....i put the ice in a canvas bag I purchased on Amazon. I'm sure the dimensions were given however, I wasn't paying attention so when it arrived I was shocked at the size. Not only does this crush ice really well, I also now have a weapon in the house although it is a bit heavy for me so I'm not sure how well I would be able to wield it. LOL!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren from OC

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, but needs modification
customer_reviews.text: This mallet is a good deal but it needs some modification to make it comfortable. The handle has sharp edges, and in my mallet the head was not square to the handle. There was some chipping around the edges of the mortise on the head. This is not a big deal because we woodworkers can take care of these problems. Aside from that, the mallet is tough and it is a useful weight for chisels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this one seems fine to me
customer_reviews.text: First mallet. I've used a rubber one, and a carpenters hammer, but this is the real deal. Had no idea how much easier chiseling would be. The quality of this one seems fine to me, it's wood, key for a wooden mallet, and I've abused it doing "other things" less gentle... And it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rob's Cabin

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for more whack for your buck, get this one. I use it for home and shop and it never fails to disappoint. Tightens up after a few uses as the handle is kind of loose when you first get it. The more that you work it, the better it fits and tights the head against the head. Fits my hand rally well, and the weight is pleasant to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Coney

customer_reviews.title: Little Rough
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, this arrives with a bit of a rough edge. If you plan to get this, make sure you have some sandpaper handy. Other than that, it's got a great heft to it, will work well for ice crushing.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: I rarely write reviews, but I feel this product ...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but I feel this product deserves one. As soon as I opened the package, I noticed a split/crack on the bottom of the hammer leading to the face on one side. At the top of the head where the handle goes through, the hole is incredibly sloppily cut. I guess I expected too much from this highly rated item, of which I'll be using for "fine woodworking."
customer_reviews.author: M. Aurelius

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Wooden Mallet
customer_reviews.text: The Crown 4-1/2-inch Beech-wood Mallet will be a nice addition in the shop for use with wood chisels and other striking tools. This is a well made tool and it meets my expectations for design, functionality, and durability. I wish that Crown would place a more permanent product stamp on their tools instead of a PSA label.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Quality at it’s best.
customer_reviews.text: I love well made quality tools. This mallet exceeded my expectations. I rubbed a coat of oil base stain on it and it will be ready to use just as soon as it dries. I cannot understand the few negative reviews I read. As I said it exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Wrong Way Bill

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great for me.
customer_reviews.text: This has worked out great for me. I had an old one that had seen better days and needed to be replaced. The price on this one being so low really surprised, but it turned out to be a good quality and handling mallet. Works great in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet, but it's built like a tank.
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say, this mallet is built like a tank. I haven't used it yet, so I cant speak on whether or not it will hold up when actually used, but just from holding it, I think its going to work out just fine. If not I will make sure to update at a later point.
customer_reviews.author: Lino412

customer_reviews.title: Oh for goodness sake, I've spent 20 years working ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh for goodness sake, I've spent 20 years working with wood and never owned one of these. What an idiot. It took about 30 seconds of using this mallet with my new chisels to realize `OH! Now I get it!' Honestly, it's silly to go without this tool. If you use chisels in woodworking, you have to have this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Mallet.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first wooden mallet, so I do not have anything to compare with.. but I really like this guy. Its very hard, sturdy, and seemingly well built. The finish is also smooth and it fits nicely in my hand. Other reviews mention that they needed to sand down the handle. I've not seen the need for it, at least so far... its very smooth. As far as wooden mallets, in general, they're definitely handy. I used to use a scrap piece of wood and a standard issue hammer to tap things into place when I did not want to scar the work piece. This mallet saves me a bit of trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Hand Luke

customer_reviews.title: A nice mallet that requires 10 mins of work before using
customer_reviews.text: A nice mallet that requires 10 mins of work before using. I've lightly sanded mine to knock off sharp edges, finished with boiled linseed oil and gave it a rub with fine steel wool and a bit of wax. It's beech so it changed its color to nice dark golden.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Fits my hand.
customer_reviews.text: Never used a wooden mallet b3fore this one. Little to compare this mallet against.
customer_reviews.author: max stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great Mallet
customer_reviews.text: Makes a real difference while driving chisels. I had no idea you needed a mallet instead of a metal hammer. It has spring to drive the chisel worth more control and power.
customer_reviews.author: Austin  Brown

customer_reviews.title: I like it very much, very nice tool
customer_reviews.text: This mallet is overall well done. As most of the tools you get now a days, they are machine cut and not perfectly finished. I had to sand all the edges specially on the handle to make it much more comfortable. So far is working fine, a beautiful tool as well. Not too heavy so on mortises you need a bit extra punch.
customer_reviews.author: rubcapgarTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Its a mallet, good but not finished
customer_reviews.text: it works as expected and is good quality, not sure what else there is to say about a mallet. As other have mentioned, you will need to sand and seal it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: blind_skwirl

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: This is my first foray into a wood mallet for use with chisels. Have used it several time; most pretty quick. But my son used it for several hours straight to hollow out a large driftwood to make a planter. It held up through all of that and he never complained of it hurting his hands (then again, he is 22 and tough). But overall, I am quite impressed.
customer_reviews.author: NovaraMark

customer_reviews.title: Good piece, well made.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I've used mine for a fair amount of chisel work and it seems to be holding up well. Now that I've got one I'll probably use it to make my own in the future, but this was a solid purchase and I don't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Aeschylus

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the price. Spend a little time putting a small bevel on the edges that need it and you have yourself a great joiner’s mallet.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Crown Mallet
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful tool. Blemish free as it should be. Comes from England and old world makers. I was even more impressed with its dimensions and weight when it came. Right angle's for striking a chisel dead center and the correct width of the striking faces. Expect to use this mallet for many years. Thanks for making available.
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Simply Nice...
customer_reviews.text: Like all Crown tools this is exceptional. I use it for all my carving applications as it feels good in the hand. The angled wide face makes it easy to use while you focus on your work. Treat yourself to something nice, I did with no regret...
customer_reviews.author: LowJack

customer_reviews.title: Wow. This guy packs a punch! I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This guy packs a punch! I have been beating out large thru-mortis' for a 5" deep worksurface and it told the chisel where to go. period.
customer_reviews.author: Perseus

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Not really heavy enough for my preferences. Head comes off the handle with every blow. Handle needs to be contoured for comfort. I recommend spending a bit more for a better one.
customer_reviews.author: TMM

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer for woodworking. I put 2 coats of tung oil on it and the wood soaked it up great and was ready for use. It is very sturdy and seems jointed together very well. Next step is to drill a small hole at the end of the handle and tie a leather loop to loop around my wrist when using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy heavy hitting mallet!
customer_reviews.text: Good buy, I'd definitely get another if needed. Nice wooden mallet. Well balanced, comfortable handle and swings great. I did some heavy chisel work with it in the spring and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M Bazor

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Good mallet, good price. I did some sanding and coated with boiled linseed oil.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen from Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Takes a beating.
customer_reviews.text: I saw this mallet being used by Greenwood Woodworking on YouTube. I decided to try it out. It takes a beating and dents pretty easily, but it’s a hard working tool.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Groenhout

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight. So much better than the hard rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: My first wooden mallet and it feels decent in hand. Nice weight. So much better than the hard rubber mallet I was using for hand chopping mortises. The only negative is that I did not make it for myself. Ha.
customer_reviews.author: JAY E MESAWITZ

customer_reviews.title: Cracked easily
customer_reviews.text: I was using this mallet for some woodshaving, and after only an hour's use, the head of the mallet cracked!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mallet
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used a wooden mallet since high school. But, since I recently purchased the high quality Stanley 16-401 Bailey Chisel set, I also decided I needed ti use a proper mallet rather than my old habit of using a claw hammer. I can tell you aftet the first use I could tell I was happy with my purhase and it is an excellent companion to my new chisel set. It will serve me well beyond the remaining years and will be passed down!
customer_reviews.author: Createaneutron

customer_reviews.title: Great, well balanced, mallet.
customer_reviews.text: Great balanced mallet. The beechwood is just firm enough to deliver the mass needed but soft enough not to mar or damage other tools. It has a good hand feel and stout & sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P

customer_reviews.title: Crown me!
customer_reviews.text: Luv it. Weighted nicely for me an my projects. Hard enough to give a positive feel when setting joints or a chisel edge. I'm very pleased with the feel of the handle too....inexpensive whim buy, so glad I did get it.
customer_reviews.author: JAG

customer_reviews.title: Hammer Down!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful piece of equipment, and needs to be in every wood working shop, and some shops that work on metallic items, tool Ergonomically correct facings on the head make it a perfect device for driving pegs, working with chisels, or any other task that requires a non-marking tap to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Hollar

customer_reviews.title: Head falls off
customer_reviews.text: The head slid off before the first use. Tapped it back on and it's OK at best. Guess if you have to change the handle or head this issue wouldn't be an issue.pit a coat of Danish oil on it and it does what it's supposed to do!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Schwy

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Mallet
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this mallet. Well made and very attractive. It is unfinished so I will likely add a coat of oil or varnish of some kind. That is not a problem for me. It's a basic, affordable and well made mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Solarcompass

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mallet
customer_reviews.text: love it, started using it as soon as I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight and design of this tool, it is perfect for my woodworking needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good mallet, but I sure do wish the head ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mallet, but I sure do wish the head would stop slipping off the handle in the middle of projects!
customer_reviews.author: Zack C

customer_reviews.title: Item as described and does the job
customer_reviews.text: The mallet is nicely machined and the head fits the handle well. It has good balance (at least for me) and does well with chisels. It does not have a finish on it and the edges of the handle could use some easing, but that's what I expected when I bought it. Can't beat the price, especially considering how much time and material I would have in one that I made myself.
customer_reviews.author: David A Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: I received my mallet to find it was very crooked.
customer_reviews.author: IloveYAbooks

customer_reviews.title: Crown 4-1/2-inch Beechwood Mallet ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a family member who was giving it as a gift to her husband who is getting into wood working. Had it shipped here so I could laser engrave the handle for her before she gave it for Christmas. Great quality. Thinking of getting one for myself when I have time to get back into woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rogoski

customer_reviews.title: Hammered!
customer_reviews.text: Works well with mortise chisels for chopping out mortises. Just the right amount of heft to the blow.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one of these don’t know how I made it without one good quality
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs one of these don’t know how I made it without one good quality
customer_reviews.author: Retired

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality Beechwood Mallet, used daily in our wood shop. Pretty popular too, the last one was stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Kinsey C.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t know how much I would use it before I ordered it but I use it about every day. Good quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Bowling

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: The weight of the tool is perfect. Makes chisel work easy and precise. I had no idea how much better it would make cleaning up corners and pockets. I look forward to years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Detroit

customer_reviews.title: Nice mallot
customer_reviews.text: As a previous reviewer mentioned, it’s really a blank. Needs sanded and finished. Overall a nice mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kovach

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Much better than making my own
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Much better than making my own. The weight just seems 'right;. You can tell these guys have been making/using these a while. As for the sharp edges? Grab some 220 sand paper and sand them off.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Drager

customer_reviews.title: but it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I had to clean the handle up slightly when it arrived, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, rounded edges, perfect balance, flawless wood, perfect fit of handle to mallet, made in England. A+ I intend to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Houghton

customer_reviews.title: IT'S HAMMER TIME
customer_reviews.text: Being a machinist by trade, I find this mallet a very nicely made piece. I am 100% happy with this, I wish i had bought it a long time ago. seems to be all raw wood. A little smoothing on handle is about all i would do.
customer_reviews.author: mojowurkn

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good buy. I received this mallet today, and it was what I expected. Yes I had to do a little sanding on the handle to make it comfortable. And I put about 6 coats of tongue oil it. But if you are any kind of woodworker, this is a non issue. I plan on buying a few more for a couple of friends.
customer_reviews.author: birdhunter

customer_reviews.title: MALLET HITS THE MARK!
customer_reviews.text: The Crown Mallet arrived promptly on Amazon Prime and was just as advertised. It is a well made piece. The handle slides easily out the mallet head, but by design works perfectly when in use with the mallet head. It feels and looks like a classy piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Schutter

customer_reviews.title: A hit.
customer_reviews.text: Mallets must be the original tool, and there's not much to differentiate them. This has decent heft, clear solid beech wood, and will serve the purpose. It can be improved by doing a bit of work on the handle, simply to make it a bit more comfortable. You would likely do that in any case, so this one is decent value.
customer_reviews.author: James G, Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Nice product that's well made
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality mallet. Keeps my chisels from becoming deformed or otherwise using the wrong tool (no steel hammers for chisels) and is heavy enough and well made enough to stand up to repeated use with no issues. Overall a nicely made product that's well-priced and holds up well enough to last several years.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Poorly finished tool.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, terrible finish job and damaged in manufacture or storage. Handle has crush mark on both sides with protruding splinters. One face of mallet has chunk missing from wood.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has been a good hammer. Used boiled linseed oil when it arrived and has worked well so far. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: really disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: arrived new but beat to hell!! as though it had been kicked around a warehouse forever! really disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: michael tierney

customer_reviews.title: ... than I thought it would be but of very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: A little lighter than I thought it would be but of very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Killercrane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made mallet at a reasonable price. Very handy for both woodworking and leather craft
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P Lillard

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: Tools that are beautiful in addition to serving their purpose are a joy to use. This is a lovely mallet, well balanced so it's good for carving. It's on the lighter side, so keep that in mind if you plan on working on harder woods.
customer_reviews.author: Anand Bhardwaj

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Mallet for a few months. No problems. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Maines

customer_reviews.title: it works as well as it looks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this, then used Tung Oil on it. It's looks so good I displayed it on my tool board up front. I also used it on a couple of chisels so it works as well as it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: I'm assuming he liked it because it was on his wish list
customer_reviews.text: A gift. I'm assuming he liked it because it was on his wish list.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good mallet
customer_reviews.text: It has a broad striking surface, so you can watch the chisel point and not the handle when making precise cuts. The handle is reverse-tapered so that the head tightens down against it with each swing. It's a good mallet so far.
customer_reviews.author: wolfboy001

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: The kink of tool that should last for a lifetime. You do need to sank off the rough edges of the wood handle, but so what!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great mallet, and at a price the makes it ...
customer_reviews.text: great mallet, and at a price the makes it easier than making one. It comes unfinished, and with some rough edges, 2 mins on the sander and a little mineral oil makes a big difference in feel.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, I use mine everyday in my business
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, I use mine everyday in my business. The only change I made was to shorten the length of the handle above the head.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Very nice wood mallet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice wood mallet. Solid and should last a life time if not abused. Well balanced. In the past I have made my own but over the year's they were all lost somehow so I decided to buy one this time. Thank's
customer_reviews.author: Old Timer

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Good mallet, arrived unfinished and i recommend adding a coat of linseed oil. its heavy and helps get parts to fit without hurting the surface
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoTrains

customer_reviews.title: Like it.
customer_reviews.text: Good for chiseling and I use it for some upholstery work. Holding up well
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Simple and sturdy. It's nice enough to make me happy
customer_reviews.text: Simple and sturdy. It's nice enough to make me happy, and inexpensive enough to let me use it guilt free.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful mallet. I love working with this beechwood mallet on my workbench. It has a nice weight to it and does the job I'd hoped for without marring my projects.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Seems good!
customer_reviews.text: Head of the mallet popped off the handle once, but I jammed it back on and continued use. Seems good!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Until then this little guy works great.
customer_reviews.text: I know what your thinking and yes, I should build my own. Which I will when the lumber I have is dry enough. Until then this little guy works great.
customer_reviews.author: swimchristianswim

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I took so long to buy it. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rubigno

customer_reviews.title: Excellent woodworking mallet after a little work.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent mallet for the money...I just knocked off the sharp edges, put on three coats of light walnut finish Danish oil, and I've been merrily chopping out dovetail pins with this for a few days now.
customer_reviews.author: SBH

customer_reviews.title: Good for crushing ice
customer_reviews.text: We use it to crush ice for cocktails. It save the blender blades.
customer_reviews.author: Magnolia

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Does the job nicely. I wish it was a little heavier but that just me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This works well. The head has to be hammered down onto the handle VERY firmly and it still tends to work loose. So, I glued it. The wood surface is rough, and you might prefer to do some finish sanding.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazon-er

customer_reviews.title: Good mallet.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mallet with my wood-handled and plastic-handled chisels. It is pretty much what you expect. I did sand down the handle a bit to fit. Much improvement over my old method (of alternating between a piece of scrap white oak and an actual hammer)!
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Jones

customer_reviews.title: John Henry approved (he would)
customer_reviews.text: As far as mallets go this one is light weight yet very strong and sturdy,when I use it I do just want to pull back and John Henry whatever I'm using it for
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Pound that ice!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mallet! Sure - any blunt instrument can pound your ice into shavings ... but they won't look as nice as this heavy mallet! This is a must have for your mint julep setup. It sometimes gathers as many comments as the drinks themselves, lol!
customer_reviews.author: LadyUstriess

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The weight is perfect, and it's perfectly balanced. Works great with my Lewis canvas bag.
customer_reviews.author: SuzB

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Handle was a little rough. I worked it with some fine sand paper and it feels much better in your hand
customer_reviews.author: William Underhill

customer_reviews.title: Bought this with the Ice Sack. Adds to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with the Ice Sack. Adds to the Bar, and bag lasts a lot longer than beatting the plastin one for crushed Ice.
customer_reviews.author: James T Brown

customer_reviews.title: Smooth the handle a bit, but still great.
customer_reviews.text: A nice mallet to use with my chisels and for joinery. Like some other reviewers mentions, you might want to take some sandpaper to the handle to smooth it out a bit, but still a 5-star product.
customer_reviews.author: Parceiro

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Good chisel mallet weight is good for precision work and angled face is good geometry for persuading wood into place with a good thump without marring what you're building.
customer_reviews.author: Drool

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet!  Use it with chisels!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mallet for use with my chisels. Like another reviewer, I sanded the handle down when I got it. The edges were a little too edgy for me so I just rounded them off a bit. Then I hit my chisels with it. It works.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: NICE MALLET FOR GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this order Mallet is of really good workmanship. Do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mallet. Sturdy, balanced and a nice weight! I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I used this with Stanley Sweetheart chisels, and it worked as expected. Nice fit and finish, no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: fine english made
customer_reviews.text: its a good wooden mallet , nice wood and feels good in my hands . I'm glad I bought this for starting my wood working , with this the chances of hitting myself from missing the chisel are none .
customer_reviews.author: William K.
